newsitem.title: MEXICO: Strong winds keep Mexico crude oil ports closed.
newsitem.headline: Strong winds keep Mexico crude oil ports closed.

text.p: Three of Mexico's main crude oil shipping ports remained closed on Sunday afternoon due to strong winds, government officials said.
The three main crude oil ports - Dos Bocas, Pajaritos (part of Coatzacoalcos), and Cayo Arcas were first closed Saturday due to the bad weather.
"We are closed becuase of the strong winds. Navigation could be restarted tomorrow," said a spokesman for the Pajaritos port.
In total, five ports were closed on Sunday, including Ciudad del Carmen and Campeche, the Ministry of Communications and Transport said on Sunday.
Tampico and Altamira ports were closed on Saturday but reopened on Sunday, the ministry said.
The main crude ports are used by state-owned oil and gas monopoly Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) to load and ship crude to the United States and Europe from Gulf of Mexico fields.
